webscript.description: Search data by criteria Criteria are set in the input json in the form of triples: field, predicate, value. The input json is a plain object, in which triples are denoted with prefix, e.g. field_0, predicate_0, value_0, field_1, predicate_1, value_1, ...

arg.description: Name of field to search by. It can be qname of any property or association or one of special values: "type", "aspect".
Search predicate, e.g. string-equals, number-greater-than, ... Some predicates require value, some do not.
Value to search after. It can be omitted, if predicate does not require value.
Number of elements to skip, used for paging.
Maximum number of elements to output, used for paging.

Array of sort parameters: each sort parameter is an object with keys 'attribute' and 'order': { "attribute": "cm:name", "order": "asc" }. Key 'order' has two variants: "asc" (ascending) and "desc" (descending). If 'order' is not specified, ascending is assumed.
